name: abmc
details:
This astrobrick provides many functions of celestial mechanics.
Conversion of angles, dates. Ephemeris calculations.

types.details:
The definition of a date can be writed by differents forms :

jd : a floating number upper or equal to 1000000 defines a julian date
mjd : a floating number lower to 1000000 defines a modified julian date (jd - 2400000.5)
NOW : the word now takes the date and the time from the operating system.
NOW0 : the word now0 takes the date and the time at 0h a.m. from the operating system
NOW1 : the word now1 takes the date and the time at 24h p.m. from the operating system
{year month day h m s} : a gregorian date as a calendar. It is possible to use floating numbers. For instance {2001 12 23.567}.
yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.ss : a gregorian date coded as the format DATE-OBS of a header FITS
J2000 : definition date for an equinox (B1950, J2010.56, etc.).

N.B. Words NOW, NOW0 et NOW1 can be written uppercase or lowercase without incidence.
types.author: Alain Klotz

types.details:
An angle can be written by many ways. Some following exemples show these possibilities :

45°34'28" :
45d34m28s : is equal to 45°34'28"
45:34:28 : is equal to 45°34'28"
45d34m28s9 : is equal to 45°34'28.9"
45d34m28.9s : is equal to 45°34'28.9"
45d34 : is equal to 45°34'
45.34 : is interpreted as 45.34 decimal degrees.
-45d34.5 : is interpreted as -45°34'30"
1h30m : is interpreted as 22.5 decimal degrees (1 hour is equal to 15 degrees).
1.57r : is interpreted as 1.57 radians.
45 34 28.4 : is interpreted as 45d34m28.4s
1 30 h : is interpreted as 1h30m.
1.57 r : is interpreted as 1.57 radians
types.author: Alain Klotz

functions.brief: Conversion from Date input in any format to Julian day.
functions.details:
Julian day is a real number which increase by a unit at 12h.
See help of type Date to list all the input possibilities.
functions.author: Alain Klotz

functions.brief: Conversion from Angle input in any format to degrees.
functions.details:
Output angle will be returned in degrees between -360 and +360.
See help of type Angle to list all the input possibilities.
functions.author: Alain Klotz

functions.brief: Conversion from Angle input in any format to sexagesimal according a specified format.
functions.details:
See help of type Angle to list all the input possibilities.
The output string will be written according the string format. The string format uses 0 to 6 characters symbolized by uspzad. The details of each character is:

u (unit) = h,H,d,D (default=D)
s (separator) = " ",:,"" (default="")
p (plus/moins) = +,"" (default="")
z (zeros) = 0,"" (default="")
a (angle_digits) = 1,2,3 (default=3 if unit D,H)
d (sec_digits) = "",".1",".2",... (default="")

Note for units: h is to convert into hours (-12h to +12h), H is to convert into hours (0h to 24h). d is to convert into degrees (-180d to 180d), D is to convert into degrees (0d to 360d).
functions.author: Alain Klotz
